title: Basic Usage
content: For details, see the following example.
findIntroStr: Used to configure options for different scenarios. Users can select multiple options from a group of options.

title: Checkbox Group and Vertical Checkbox Group
content: Manages multiple checkbox elements into a group through the checkbox-group element. In checkbox-group, use v-model to bind variables of the Array type to implement bidirectional binding. The label attribute of the checkbox is its corresponding value. If there is no content in the tag, the attribute also serves as the introduction after the checkbox. label corresponds to the element value in the array. If the specified value exists, the value is selected. Otherwise, the value is not selected.
findIntroStr: Used to configure options for different scenarios. Users can select multiple options from a group of options.

title: Profile Checkbox Group
content: Provides the options attribute. You can render a check box group by configuring object array data. With this attribute, you no longer need to insert the checkbox or checkbox-button element as a slot in the tag. The options object array contains three fields: label, text, and events. The type attribute is also provided, which is used with the options attribute. The default value is checkbox. You can also set this parameter to button. After the configuration, the check box group is displayed as a button.
findIntroStr: Used to configure options for different scenarios. Users can select multiple options from a group of options.

title: All and Half
content: After the indeterminate attribute is set to true in the checkbox element, the check box is displayed as half-selected.
findIntroStr: Used to configure options for different scenarios. Users can select multiple options from a group of options.

title: Quantity Limit
content: On the checkbox-group, the min and max attributes can be used to specify the minimum and maximum values of the options that can be selected.
findIntroStr: Used to configure options for different scenarios. Users can select multiple options from a group of options.

title: Currently selected
content: Whether to select checked. You can set disabled to disable the component.
findIntroStr: Configure options for different scenarios. Users can select multiple options from a group of options.

title: button form check box
content: Embed checkbox-button into the checkbox-group element to implement a checkbox group in the form of a button. Fill color and border color when the checkbox is activated by pressing the fill button. The default value is #409EFF.
findIntroStr: Configure options for different scenarios. Users can select multiple options from a group of options.

title: vertical layout
content: Set vertical to true on the checkbox-group element, The checkbox-button or checkbox managed by it is displayed as a vertical layout.
findIntroStr: Configure options for different scenarios. Users can select multiple options from a group of options.

title: Dynamicly generate check box groups
content: The data required by the check box group can be obtained from the background through the request service and then dynamically generated.
findIntroStr: Configure options for different scenarios. Users can select multiple options from a group of options.

title: Prompt message when the content exceeds the upper limit
content: If the introduction text next to the check box exceeds the limit, you can use the Tooltip component to add a prompt. When you hover the cursor over the tooltip component, you can prompt all the contents. Set the border attribute to true on the checkbox element to display the border.
findIntroStr: Configure options for different scenarios. Users can select multiple options from a group of options.

title: Text
content: Set the text content in the text attribute. Use true-label to set the selected value, and false-label to set the unselected value.
findIntroStr: Configure options for different scenarios. Users can select multiple options from a group of options.

title: Text Selection
content: uses true-label to set the selected value and false-label to set the unselected value.
findIntroStr: Configure options for different scenarios. Users can select multiple options from a group of options.

title: Dimension
content: When the check box is a button, you can set the size of the button through the size attribute. The options are medium, small, and mini. Setting the disabled property on checkbox-button will disable a check button. If the disabled attribute is configured on the checkbox-group tab, all check buttons are disabled.
findIntroStr: Configure options for different scenarios. Users can select multiple options from a group of options.

title: Event
content: The change event is triggered when the value of the check box is changed.
findIntroStr: Configure options for different scenarios. Users can select multiple options from a group of options.

title: Slot
content: Multi-line button group, after exceeding the maximum width, it will be displayed in a new line.
findIntroStr: Configure options for different scenarios. Users can select multiple options from a group of options.
